title: I Ate Every Food at the Most Expensive Buffet

comments: I love that that guy recognized you in Circus Circus and was immediately like "Wtf are you doing *here*" hahaha

Dylan, just a heads up to you and anyone else that wants to experience the buffets in Vegas, dinner is actually served at 3pm and on. Crab legs are available at all buffets during the weekends starting on Friday to Sunday (dinners only). Note to all, typically the dinner buffet cost (regardless of location) increases by nearly 100% when compared to both breakfast and/or lunch prices. The trick to save a tremendous amount of money is to set your reservation between 2pm to 2:30pm. If you get there prior to 3pm, you'll hit the "better" food items at lunch prices.

Cheap buffets, especially here in vegas, use powdered eggs.  Also never go to a breakfast buffet, do brunch. If you can, take a local or get the casinos players card, you get discounts for locals at some places, and usually with the players card.  And NEVER go to anything less than 4 stars in Vegas.  The Wynn has the best buffet, always go on the weekend if you can get a spot. Also, FYI most strip buffets get their desserts from the same company, they're rarely made in house. üòä
Buffet rookie, you need to have 3+ full plates to get your moneys worth
I can feel the food poisoning through my screen ü•¥
Even though I don't think I've ever taken 90 minutes to eat a meal, the time limit on the most expensive one with the most choices would make me feel so rushed and ruin the experience

My family and I used to go to the Bacchanal Buffet every summer when we went to Vegas!! Unfortunately we stopped cuz of Covid lockdowns and bc they became super expensive. $100 is what we paid for for 4-5 people in my family and it was our highlight of the summer since we‚Äôre not rich. Sad to see it‚Äôs now $100 for one person and a time limit. Plus all the food and look is the same :(
The only things you can find at Circus Circus are sadness and disappointment.

The reason the wagyu was not what you were expecting is because wagyu is a term for four specific Japanese cattle breeds that vary immensity and don't even have to be raised in Japan. That along with the different marbling grades, the piece you ate was no better than normal beef you'd pick up at your local store.

What you really want to be eating when thinking about Japanese wagyu is beef that has a specific location as the name: Kobe, Matsusaka, Omi ect along with it being a high marbling grade A4/A5.

I hope that clears up some of the problems with "wagyu" beef that is heavily marketed and misleading to the general public.

You missed out on some of the best parts of the Wynn Buffet: it has king crab legs in many variations, lobster of course, filet mignon with chimichurri sauce, charcuterie with very exotic cheeses, and last but not least (and the reason a lot of people go) the caviar station.

16:05 The Wagyu might have been American Wagyu which is misleading. American Wagyu is technically the worst type of Wagyu. Aussie Wagyu is better than American and Japanese Wagyu is better than both.
